title: Tyson Fury reveals he will link up with Conor McGregor in bid to make MMA switch
text:
Tyson Fury is prepared to take a step away from boxing and turn his attention to MMA with the help of UFC star Conor McGregor who is ready to become his trainer.

Fury has already investigated life outside of boxing with WWE. His flirtation with the company continues this week when he takes on Braun Strowman in Saudi Arabia.

But for now a permanent switch to WWE is not in his long term plans, especially with plans to fight Deontay Wilder twice in 2020.

Tyson Fury has stated he is interested in an MMA move and being trained by Conor McGregor

Fury spoke about his plans while attending an NFL event at Wembley Stadium on Sunday

Beyond boxing though a move to MMA greatly interests the Gypsy King who is looking to team up with McGregor, hinting they could even feature as a double-header.

'You might see Tyson Fury have his MMA debut this year,' he told Sky Sports during an NFL event at Wembley. 'It's different but, like I say, Tyson Fury [is] taking over.

'I've been speaking to Conor [McGregor] about it and he's willing to train me and it's going to be good.

"We may see Tyson Fury have his MMA debut this year"@Tyson_Fury has announced he wants to make his MMA debut this year, and may even be trained by @TheNotoriousMMA. pic.twitter.com/QJnZf3Eiq0 — Sky Sports News (@SkySportsNews) October 27, 2019

Conor McGregor tweeted his approval at training Fury in making the switch from boxing

'I come from a long line of bare knuckle boxing champions and getting hurt, getting bloodied.

'You saw in my last fight that there was blood everywhere, it's nothing new to me. It's all a part of my heritage. I would love to get in there and smash someone up.

'He [McGregor] just said 'any time you're ready, let's go. Come over to Dublin and we'll start training'. I can't wait. I'm going to take him up on the offer.

'We might be on a double header - The Gypsy King and Conor McGregor. Watch this space.'

Indeed, McGregor even backed up Fury's statement, retweeting his comments with a post reading: 'Up the Fury’s! Let’s go.'
description: Fury has already investigated life outside of boxing with WWE, but now has his future after boxing set on making a switch to MMA with help from UFC star McGregor.
